Package com.projectps.buildingmanagement.controllers.pages

Class HomeController

java.lang.Object
com.projectps.buildingmanagement.controllers.pages.HomeController
@Controller public class HomeController extends Object
Controller class for managing pages related to user authentication and navigation.

      public HomeController()

  • Method Details

    • homePage

      @GetMapping("/") public String homePage()
      Displays the home page.
      Returns:
      The name of the home page view.

    • adminPage

      @GetMapping("/admin") public String adminPage()
      Displays the admin page if the logged-in user is an admin. Otherwise, redirects to the customer page.
      Returns:
      The name of the admin page view or a redirection to the customer page.

    • customerPage

      @GetMapping("/customer") public String customerPage()
      Displays the customer page if the logged-in user is a customer. Otherwise, redirects to the admin page.
      Returns:
      The name of the customer page view or a redirection to the admin page.

    • login

      @PostMapping("/") public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView login(@RequestParam String username, @RequestParam String password)
      Handles user login and redirects to the appropriate page based on user role.
      Parameters:
      username - The username.
      password - The password.
      Returns:
      A ModelAndView indicating the result of the login attempt.

    • logout

      @GetMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView logout()
      Logs out the user and redirects to the home page.
      Returns:
      A ModelAndView for redirecting to the home page.

    • getLoggedInUser

      @GetMapping("/loggedin") public UserDTO getLoggedInUser()
      Retrieves the logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The logged-in user.

    • showSignUpPage

      @GetMapping("/signup") public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView showSignUpPage()
      Displays the sign-up page.
      Returns:
      A ModelAndView for displaying the sign-up page.

    • signUp

      @PostMapping("/signup") public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView signUp(@ModelAttribute UserDTO userDTO)
      Handles user sign-up.
      Parameters:
      userDTO - The user DTO containing user information.
      Returns:
      A ModelAndView indicating the result of the sign-up attempt.
